document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Sarcophaga (Heteronychia) (Diptera: Sarcophagidae) of Sardinia *

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Sarcophaga (Heteronychia) (Diptera: Sarcophagidae) of Sardinia *

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Sarcophaga filia Rondani, 1860: 385
. Type locality: central and northern Italy [taken from the original description; the lectotype (see below) does not carry more precise locality information].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined. Lectotype ♂ : 1006 // =
S. filia
/ sec. Typ. Pand. / det. Böttcher // LECTOTYPE ♂ /
Sarcophaga
/
filia Rond.
/ T. Pape det. 1986 //
Heteronychia
/
filia (Rond.)
/ T. Pape det. 1986 ( MZUF ) ( cf . Pape 1988 ).

Biology. One of the best-studied snail parasitoids within the subgenus; it has been bred from
Helix spp.
and
Theba pisana (Müller)
( Gastropoda : Helicidae ), and
Cernuella virgata (Da Costa)
( Gastropoda : Hygromiidae ) ( cf . Coupland & Barker 2004 ).
Remarks. New to Sardinia. Recorded from Corsica by Villeneuve (1911) .
